education.module1_content: Your heart is a muscle that pumps blood throughout your body. After a cardiac event, it needs time, rest, and gradual exercise to recover fully.
education.module2_content: Gradual, doctor-guided exercise strengthens your heart muscle. Start with short walks and increase duration slowly. Always stay in your target heart rate zone.
education.module3_content: Stop exercise immediately if you feel chest pain, dizziness, severe shortness of breath, or palpitations. Rest and contact your doctor.
education.module4_content: Focus on vegetables, fruits, whole grains, and lean proteins. Reduce sodium, saturated fats, and processed foods. Stay hydrated.
education.module5_content: Stress and poor sleep affect heart recovery. Aim for 7‚Äì9 hours of sleep. Practice deep breathing, light stretching, or mindfulness.
education.module6_content: Taking your medications as prescribed is critical. Never skip doses without consulting your doctor, even if you feel well.
